prophylaxis!

moves.16... Rfc8 17. bxc4 bxc4:
It was here I realized that my Be3 was X-raying his queen and saw Bxc4 with pawn d4-d5

Where to place my queen I thought.
moves.21. Bxc4:
!

moves.21... dxc4 22. d5 Qb3: I believe my opponent acted real confused and played this very hastily.
moves.23. dxc6 Qxa2 24. Rxa2 Bxc6:
it has here I pondering way too long on Rxa7 or Nd4.
Obviously, Rxa7 is better but I spent a good chuck of my time between these to moves
Nd4...Bd5; Be4; Bd7; Be8 were all possible. I don't think Bb7 or Ba8 were candidate moves. 
So 25. Nd4 with tempo...Any bishop move; 
26. Ra7 with tempo...Bc5 with tempo!
Oh where does my Rook go to?
And here I was lost in the forest of variations after Black gains a tempo I was lost.  
I spent too much time on this. Way too much.
I believe I spent 14-16 minutes on this move.
moves.26. Ra6: After accessing the rank was protecting by both bishops I moved back a rank.
moves.26... Be8: So here I notice my opponent didn't like complications. Even earlier He never ventured off with Nc6-Nb4 to attack my queen....

Nc6...Rb1+; Kh2...pawn c2
and dark square bishop has several squares to travel to with pawn c2

??

time: 10 min.
